Package researchsim.entities

Class Entity

  • Object
    • Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Encodable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Fauna, Flora, User
    public abstract class Entity
extends Object
implements Encodable
    An entity is an item that can exist as an inhabitant of a tile.
    They will always have an associated size and coordinate.
    This governs the key attributes and methods of every entity on the Scenario grid.
    See Also:
    Tile
    Partially implemented in assignment 1, to be completed in assignment 2

      • encode

        public String encode()
        Returns the machine-readable string representation of this Entity.

        The format of the string to return is 

        EntityClass-size-coordinate
        Where:
        • EntityClass is the entity's instance class name
        • size is the entity's associated size
        • coordinate is the encoding of the entity's associated coordinate
        For example: 
        Fauna-SMALL-1,3
        OR 
        Flora-GIANT-5,4

        Note that this encode method should not include any additional attributes that subclasses may have.
        Specified by:
        encode in interface Encodable
        Returns:
        encoded string representation of this Entity
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns the hash code of this entity.

        Two entities that are equal according to the equals(Object) method should have the same hash code.

        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        hash code of this entity.
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(Object other)
        Returns true if and only if this entity is equal to the other given object.

        For two entities to be equal, they must have the same size and coordinate.

        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        other - the reference object with which to compare
        Returns:
        true if this entity is the same as the other argument; false otherwise
        Implement this for assignment 2

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns the human-readable string representation of this Entity.

        The format of the string to return is: 

        name [EntityClass] at coordinate
        Where:
        • EntityClass is the entity's instance class simple name (see Object.getClass() )
        • name is the entity's human-readable name according to the extended class implementation of getName()
        • coordinate is the entity's associated coordinate in human-readable form
        For example: 
        Fish [Fauna] at (1,3)
        OR 
        Flower [Flora] at (6,4)
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        human-readable string representation of this Entity
        See Also:
        Fauna.getName()
        Implemented in assignment 1
